Docs.summary: Specifies the level of access allowed to a Simple Mail Transport Protocol (SMTP) server.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The SmtpAccess enumeration is used by the <xref:System.Net.Mail.SmtpPermission> and <xref:System.Net.Mail.SmtpPermissionAttribute> classes to specify a level of access to an SMTP host computer. The <xref:System.Net.Mail.SmtpClient> class demands an <xref:System.Net.Mail.SmtpPermission> when sending electronic mail to the SMTP host for delivery.
## Examples The following code example uses the SmtpAccess enumeration to create a permission object.
